item.title: Survey finds US job losses slow in July
item.description: US companies cut 371,000 jobs last month, a survey found, as the economy continues to slow its haemorrhaging of jobs

item.title: Wall Street poised for choppy start
item.description: US stocks suffered a choppy morning before the market opened after disappointing revenues from consumer giant Procter & Gamble and weaker-than-expected jobs data

item.title: Clinton returns with freed journalists
item.description: Bill Clinton, the former US president, returned to the United States with two American journalists released by North Korean leader Kim Jong-il after a ‘special pardon’

item.title: GE settles claims of fraud in accounts
item.description: General Electric agreed to pay $50m to settle civil accounting fraud charges by US regulators, calling into question the conglomerate’s legendary ability to deliver consistent earnings growth

item.title: Deutsche Bank in Sal Oppenheim stake talks
item.description: Deutsche Bank is in advanced talks on taking a minority stake in private bank Sal Oppenheim in a deal designed to boost its wealthy client business

item.title: Lloyds reports first-half loss of £4bn
item.description: The bank, partly owned by the UK government, reported a pro-forma loss of £4bn as the deteriorating state of its loan portfolio led it to take £13.4bn of impairment charges in the first half

item.title: Société Générale earnings boost Europe’s banks
item.description: Solid half year earnings from France’s Société Générale meant European banking shares were in demand on Wednesday, helping the wider market creep back towards its high for 2009

item.title: SEC set to target flash trading
item.description: The Securities and Exchange Commission is preparing to clamp down on lightning-fast ‘flash’ trades, which are made at lightning speeds on electronic trading systems amid growing concerns that ontroversy over the practice puts some investors at a disadvantage

item.title: Wife of Taliban chief killed in missile attack
item.description: The wife of Pakistani Taliban chief Baitullah Mehsud was killed on Wednesday in a missile strike by a suspected US drone in the South Waziristan tribal region

item.title: Ahmadi-Nejad sworn in as Iran's president
item.description: Mahmoud Ahmadi-Nejad was sworn in as Iran’s president, nearly eight weeks after a disputed election that unleashed the worst unrest since the 1979 Islamic revolution and divided the political and clerical elite
